meanings.definition: The action of marrying a person of a superior caste or class.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, hypergamy is a common practice where individuals marry into higher social groups.
meanings.sent2: Her hypergamy led her to marry a wealthy businessman from the city.
meanings.sent3: At the royal ball, hypergamy was the talk of the town as commoners tried to catch the eye of nobility.
meanings.sent4: The concept of hypergamy in relationships can sometimes lead to societal divides.
meanings.sent5: Hypergamy, the act of marrying up, has been a theme in many classic novels.

meanings.definition: The practice of seeking a spouse of higher socioeconomic status.
meanings.sent1: Hypergamy can be seen in individuals who prioritize wealth and status when choosing a partner.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of hypergamy when she left her modest hometown to marry a millionaire.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed hypergamy by exaggerating the lengths some go to for a wealthy partner.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, hypergamy can be compared to mergers between companies of different financial standings.
meanings.sent5: The movie highlighted hypergamy as a driving force behind the characters' decisions.
